name: arch::mm::tlb_flush_addr

x86_64::VirtAddr::new.doc:
Creates a new canonical virtual address.

 This function performs sign extension of bit 47 to make the address canonical.

 ## Panics

 This function panics if the bits in the range 48 to 64 contain data (i.e. are not null and no sign extension).

x86_64::instructions::tlb::flush.doc: Invalidate the given address in the TLB using the `invlpg` instruction.

doc:
Flush any TLB entry that contains the map of the given virtual address.

 This flush performs regardless of the global-page bit. So it can flush both global
 and non-global entries.
